column5: A friend is going up tomorrow any reports on what to expect?  Thanks

its been dry this year and hot...expect the deer and horse flys to be pretty bad  blackflies will be long gone  and the skitters shouldnt be that bad except at dusk. But even then they shouldnt be that bad this year because of the heat. I would say bring some bug dope and you should be fine.

Just got back last night from that area and I can say the bugs are not a problem at all . As the above post states it has been very dry up there this year and that has put the skids on a lot of the bugs. Blackflies are long gone , skeeters only at dusk and deer flies are pretty well gone but are still out in some areas . I have a place just outside of McKellar and there is no deer flies but go a little north of there and they are still buzzing around .
I am 15 minutes North of Parry sound on Shebeshekong Lake and as everyone has said it has been pretty dry up here not many skeeters but the deer fly's are around.  Cheers Mitch
Set out a Blue beach ball, hat, plastic solo cup, etc.  covered with Tanglefoot, keeps the last ones from bugging you.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mg3HQ8Alo7A  Cheers, Mark

Set out a Blue beach ball, hat, plastic solo cup, etc.  covered with Tanglefoot, keeps the last ones from bugging you.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mg3HQ8Alo7A  Cheers, Mark   this video is incredible ahhahahaha

Just got back from the burksfalls area bud. I didnt even get a mosqitou bite. Usually I get eaten alive while setting up the toon. 1 deer fly all morning. He dead now though. Fish food. Dragon flys were fun to watch.
Deer flies are terrible on the french right now. Mosquitoes surprisingly not bad at all. Just that short period after sundown.
